title: Sell Rosebank Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Rosebank Whisky | Flora & Fauna & Rare Malts | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Rosebank whisky. We buy the Flora & Fauna 12 Year, Rare Malts, and the new 30/31 Year releases from the 'King of the Lowlands'.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for Rosebank Flora & Fauna, Rare Malts, and aged releases.
introParagraph: Rosebank, the 'King of the Lowlands', is famous for its floral, triple-distilled character. Closed in 1993 and recently revived, original stock is highly collectible.
conditionFactors: Flora & Fauna: The wooden crate for the F&F 12 is rare; usually it is just the bottle.
Fill Level: Crucial for Rare Malts bottlings.
Label: Flora & Fauna labels can scuff easily.
pricingFactors: Series: Flora & Fauna is the iconic standard; Rare Malts is the collector grade.
Release: The new 30 and 31 year old releases from Ian Macleod are high value.
Bottler: Official bottlings usually win, but Cadenhead/Signatory Rosebanks are good.
Vintage: 1981 and 1990 are common vintage years.

faqs.question: Is the Flora & Fauna 12 valuable?
faqs.answer: Yes, while it was once a standard bottle, it is now a pricey collector item.

faqs.question: What about the new Rosebank?
faqs.answer: Ian Macleod Distillers released 'Release 1' (30 Year). We buy these new releases.

faqs.question: Do you buy St. Magdalene or Littlemill?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy other closed Lowland distilleries like St. Magdalene/Linlithgow and Littlemill.

faqs.question: What is the Rare Malts Selection?
faqs.answer: A classic series. Rosebank appeared several times. We buy them all.

faqs.question: Do I need the tube?
faqs.answer: For Rare Malts and F&F, the box/tube is less critical than the bottle condition, but nice to have.

faqs.question: Is Triple Distilled better?
faqs.answer: It is Rosebank's signature style (lighter, floral). Collectors love it.
